baal_573.name: Baal (the Hebrew Bible as the primary god of t)
baal_573.bio: The name appropriated to the principal male god of the Phoenicians. It is found in several places in the plural BAALIM ([Judg. 2:11](/judg#Judg.2.11); [10:10](/judg#Judg.10.10); [1 Kings 18:18](/1kgs#1Kgs.18.18); [Jer.

baal_575.name: Baal (of Jerusalem)
baal_575.bio: A Benjamite, son of Jehiel, the progenitor of the Gibeonites ([1 Chr. 8:30](/1chr#1Chr.8.30); [9:36](/1chr#1Chr.9.36)).

baal-hanan_576.name: Baal-hanan (Son of Merari)
baal-hanan_576.bio: A king of Edom, son of Achbor ([Gen. 36:38](/gen#Gen.36.38), [39](/gen#Gen.36.39); [1 Chr. 1:49](/1chr#1Chr.1.49), [50](/1chr#1Chr.1.50)).

baal-hanan_577.name: Baal-hanan (officer in charge of orchards in the She)
baal-hanan_577.bio: An overseer of “the olive trees and sycomore trees in the low plains” (the Shephelah) under David ([1 Chr. 27:28](/1chr#1Chr.27.28)).

baal-zebub_579.name: Baal-zebub
baal-zebub_579.bio: Fly-lord, the god of the Philistines at Ekron ([2 Kings 1:2](/2kgs#2Kgs.1.2), [3](/2kgs#2Kgs.1.3), [16](/2kgs#2Kgs.1.16)). This name was given to the god because he was supposed to be able to avert the plague of flies which in that region was to be feared. He was consulted by Ahaziah as to his recovery.

baalis_578.name: Baalis
baalis_578.bio: King of the Ammonites at the time of the Babylonian captivity ([Jer. 40:14](/jer#Jer.40.14)). He hired Ishmael to slay Gedaliah who had been appointed governor over the cities of Judah.

baanah_582.name: Baanah (Captain of Ish-bosheth)
baanah_582.bio: One of the two sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, a captain in Saul’s army. He and his brother Rechab assassinated Ishbosheth ([2 Sam. 4:2](/2sam#2Sam.4.2)), and were on this account slain by David, and their mutilated bodies suspended over the pool at Hebron (5, 6, 12).

baanah_583.name: Baanah (son of Ribai)
baanah_583.bio: The father of Heled, who was one of David’s thirty heroes ([2 Sam. 23:29](/2sam#2Sam.23.29); [1 Chr. 11:30](/1chr#1Chr.11.30)).

baanah_584.name: Baanah (Beeroth whose two sons)
baanah_584.bio: Son of Hushai, another of Solomon’s purveyors ([1 Kings 4:16](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.16)).

baasha_589.name: Baasha
baasha_589.bio: Bravery, the third king of the separate kingdom of Israel, and founder of its second dynasty ([1 Kings 15](/1kgs#1Kgs.15); [16](/1kgs#1Kgs.16); [2 Chr. 16:1-6](/2chr#2Chr.16.1)). He was the son of Ahijah of the tribe of Issachar.

balaam_593.name: Balaam
balaam_593.bio: Lord of the people; foreigner or glutton, as interpreted by others, the son of Beor, was a man of some rank among the Midianites ([Num. 31:8](/num#Num.31.8); comp. 16).

baladan_594.name: Baladan
baladan_594.bio: He has given a son, the father of the Babylonian king ([2 Kings 20:12](/2kgs#2Kgs.20.12); [Isa. 39:1](/isa#Isa.39.1)) Merodach-baladan (q.v.).

balak_387.name: Balak
balak_387.bio: Empty; spoiler, a son of Zippor, and king of the Moabites ([Num. 22:2](/num#Num.22.2), [4](/num#Num.22.4)). From fear of the Israelites, who were encamped near the confines of his territory, he applied to Balaam (q.v.) to curse them; but in vain ([Josh.

bani_388.name: Bani (A Gadite)
bani_388.bio: One of David’s thirty-seven warriors, a Gadite ([2 Sam. 23:36](/2sam#2Sam.23.36)).

barabbas_399.name: Barabbas
barabbas_399.bio: I.e., son of Abba or of a father, a notorious robber whom Pilate proposed to condemn to death instead of Jesus, whom he wished to release, in accordance with the Roman custom ([John 18:40](/john#John.18.40); [Mark 15:7](/mark#Mark.15.7); [Luke 23:19](/luke#Luke.23.19)). But the Jews were so bent on the death of Jesus that they demanded that Barabbas should be pardoned ([Matt. 27:16-26](/matt#Matt.27.16); [Acts 3:14](/acts#Acts.3.14)).

barachel_400.name: Barachel
barachel_400.bio: Whom God has blessed, a Buzite, the father of Elihu, one of Job’s friends ([Job 32:2](/job#Job.32.2), [6](/job#Job.32.6)).

barak_401.name: Barak
barak_401.bio: Lightning, the son of Abinoam ([Judg. 4:6](/judg#Judg.4.6)). At the summons of Deborah he made war against Jabin.

bariah_402.name: Bariah
bariah_402.bio: Fugitive, one of Shemaiah’s five sons. Their father is counted along with them in [1 Chr. 3:22](/1chr#1Chr.3.22).

barkos_404.name: Barkos
barkos_404.bio: Painter, ([Ezra 2:53](/ezra#Ezra.2.53); [Neh. 7:55](/neh#Neh.7.55)). The father of some of the Nethinim.

barnabas_1722.name: Barnabas
barnabas_1722.bio: son of consolation, the surname of Joses, a Levite ( Acts 4:36 ). His name stands first on the list of prophets and teachers of the church at Antioch ( 13:1 ). Luke speaks of him as a "good man" ( 11:24 ).

barsabas_1720.name: Barsabas
barsabas_1720.bio: son of Saba, the surname (1) of Joseph, also called Justus ( Acts 1:23 ), some identify him with Barnabas; (2) of Judas, who was a "prophet." Nothing more is known of him than what is mentioned in Acts 15:32 .

bartholomew_405.name: Bartholomew
bartholomew_405.bio: son of Tolmai, one of the twelve apostles ( Matthew 10:3 ; Acts 1:13 ); generally supposed to have been the same as Nathanael. In the synoptic gospels Philip and Bartholomew are always mentioned together, while Nathanael is never mentioned; in the fourth gospel, on the other hand, Philip and Nathanael are similarly mentioned together, but nothing is said of Bartholomew. He was one of the disciples to whom our Lord appeared at the Sea of Tiberias after his resurrection ( John 21:2 ).

bartimaeus_406.name: Bartimaeus
bartimaeus_406.bio: Son of Timaeus, one of the two blind beggars of Jericho ([Mark 10:46](/mark#Mark.10.46); [Matt. 20:30](/matt#Matt.20.30)). His blindness was miraculously cured on the ground of his faith.

baruch_410.name: Baruch (Son of neriah)
baruch_410.bio: The secretary of the prophet Jeremiah (32:12; 36:4). He was of the tribe of Judah (51:59). To him Jeremiah dictated his prophecies regarding the invasion of the Babylonians and the Captivity.

barzillai_411.name: Barzillai (A Meholathite)
barzillai_411.bio: A Gileadite of Rogelim who was distinguished for his loyalty to David. He liberally provided for the king’s followers ([2 Sam. 17:27](/2sam#2Sam.17.27)).

barzillai_412.name: Barzillai (Father of Adriel)
barzillai_412.bio: A Meholathite, the father of Adriel ([2 Sam. 21:8](/2sam#2Sam.21.8)).

barzillai_413.name: Barzillai (man of iron)
barzillai_413.bio: A priest who married a daughter of the preceding ([Ezra 2:61](/ezra#Ezra.2.61)).

bashemath_1887.name: Bashemath
bashemath_1887.bio: The daughter of Ishmael, the last of Esau’s three wives ([Gen. 36:3](/gen#Gen.36.3), [4](/gen#Gen.36.4), [13](/gen#Gen.36.13)), from whose son Reuel four tribes of the Edomites sprung. She is also called Mahalath ([Gen.

bathsheba_416.name: Bathsheba
bathsheba_416.bio: Daughter of the oath, or of seven, called also Bath-shu’a ([1 Chr. 3:5](/1chr#1Chr.3.5)), was the daughter of Eliam ([2 Sam. 11:3](/2sam#2Sam.11.3)) or Ammiel ([1 Chr.

bealiah_419.name: Bealiah
bealiah_419.bio: Whose Lord is Jehovah, a Benjamite, one of David’s thirty heroes of the sling and bow ([1 Chr. 12:5](/1chr#1Chr.12.5)).

becher_424.name: Becher (Also spelled Beker. One of Benjamin’s so)

bedan_427.name: Bedan (deliverer of Israel)
bedan_427.bio: One of the judges of Israel ([1 Sam. 12:11](/1sam#1Sam.12.11)). It is uncertain who he was.

beeri_432.name: Beeri (father of  Hosea)
beeri_432.bio: The father of Judith, one of the wives of Esau ([Gen. 26:34](/gen#Gen.26.34)), the same as Adah ([Gen. 36:2](/gen#Gen.36.2)).

bela_434.name: Bela (son of Beor)
bela_434.bio: The son of Beor, and a king of Edom ([Gen. 36:32](/gen#Gen.36.32), [33](/gen#Gen.36.33); [1 Chr. 1:43](/1chr#1Chr.1.43)).

belshazzar_437.name: Belshazzar
belshazzar_437.bio: Bel protect the king!, the last of the kings of Babylon ([Dan. 5:1](/dan#Dan.5.1)). He was the son of Nabonidus by Nitocris, who was the daughter of Nebuchadnezzar and the widow of Nergal-sharezer.

ben-ammi_451.name: Ben-ammi
ben-ammi_451.bio: Son of my kindred; i.e., “born of incest”, the son of Lot by his youngest daughter ([Gen. 19:38](/gen#Gen.19.38)).

ben-hadad_452.name: Ben-hadad (ruler of Damascus)
ben-hadad_452.bio: The king of Syria whom Asa, king of Judah, employed to invade Israel ([1 Kings 15:18](/1kgs#1Kgs.15.18)).

ben-hadad_453.name: Ben-hadad (The king of Syria whom Asa)
ben-hadad_453.bio: Son of the preceding, also king of Syria. He was long engaged in war against Israel. He was murdered probably by Hazael, by whom he was succeeded ([2 Kings 8:7-15](/2kgs#2Kgs.8.7)), after a reign of some thirty years.

ben-hadad_454.name: Ben-hadad (the son of king hazael)
ben-hadad_454.bio: King of Damascus, and successor of his father Hazael on the throne of Syria ([2 Kings 13:3](/2kgs#2Kgs.13.3), [4](/2kgs#2Kgs.13.4)). His misfortunes in war are noticed by Amos (1:4).

benaiah_439.name: Benaiah (David’s sons)
benaiah_439.bio: The son of Jehoiada, chief priest ([1 Chr. 27:5](/1chr#1Chr.27.5)). He was set by David over his body-guard of Cherethites and Pelethites ([2 Sam.

benaiah_441.name: Benaiah (A member of the family of Pahath-Moab in)

benaiah_447.name: Benaiah (in the Bible is the son of Jehoiada)

benaiah_448.name: Benaiah (commander of the Cherethites and Pelethi)

benjamin_463.name: Benjamin (son of Rachel)
benjamin_463.bio: son of my right hand. The younger son of Jacob by Rachel ( Genesis 35:18 ). His birth took place at Ephrath, on the road between Bethel and Bethlehem, at a short distance from the latter place.

beor_465.name: Beor (Bela son of Beor became king of Edom. Hi)
beor_465.bio: The father of Bela, one of the kings of Edom ([Gen. 36:32](/gen#Gen.36.32)).

beor_466.name: Beor (Father of Balaam)
beor_466.bio: The father of Balaam ([Num. 22:5](/num#Num.22.5); [24:3](/num#Num.24.3), [15](/num#Num.24.15); [31:8](/num#Num.31.8)). In 2 Pet.

bera_467.name: Bera
bera_467.bio: Gift, or son of evil, king of Sodom at the time of the invasion of the four kings under Chedorlaomer ([Gen. 14:2](/gen#Gen.14.2), [8](/gen#Gen.14.8), [17](/gen#Gen.14.17), [21](/gen#Gen.14.21)).

berachah_468.name: Berachah
berachah_468.bio: One of the Benjamite warriors, Saul’s brethren, who joined David when at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:3](/1chr#1Chr.12.3)).

berechiah_469.name: Berechiah (the son of Shimea)
berechiah_469.bio: Son of Shimea, and father of Asaph the musician ([1 Chr. 6:39](/1chr#1Chr.6.39); [15:17](/1chr#1Chr.15.17)).

berechiah_471.name: Berechiah (occurs several times)
berechiah_471.bio: The fourth of the five sons of Zerubbabel, of the royal family of Judah ([1 Chr. 3:20](/1chr#1Chr.3.20)).

berechiah_473.name: Berechiah (Blessing)
berechiah_473.bio: One of the seven Ephraimite chieftains, son of Meshillemoth ([2 Chr. 28:12](/2chr#2Chr.28.12)).

berechiah_474.name: Berechiah (The father of Meshullam the builder)

bered_476.name: Bered
bered_476.bio: A son of Shuthelah, and grandson of Ephraim ([1 Chr. 7:20](/1chr#1Chr.7.20)).

beriah_478.name: Beriah (son of Asher)
beriah_478.bio: One of Asher’s four sons, and father of Heber ([Gen. 46:17](/gen#Gen.46.17)).

beriah_479.name: Beriah (Son of Ephraim)
beriah_479.bio: A son of Ephraim ([1 Chr. 7:20-23](/1chr#1Chr.7.20)), born after the slaughter of his brothers, and so called by his father “because it went evil with his house” at that time.

beriah_480.name: Beriah (Father of Heber and Malchiel)
beriah_480.bio: A Benjamite who with his brother Shema founded Ajalon and expelled the Gittites ([1 Chr. 8:13](/1chr#1Chr.8.13)).

bernice_482.name: Bernice
bernice_482.bio: bearer of victory, the eldest daughter of Agrippa I., the Herod Agrippa of Acts 12:20 . After the early death of her first husband she was married to her uncle Herod, king of Chalcis. After his death (A.D.

bethuel_487.name: Bethuel
bethuel_487.bio: The son of Nahor by Milcah; nephew of Abraham, and father of Rebekah ([Gen. 22:22](/gen#Gen.22.22), [23](/gen#Gen.22.23); [24:15](/gen#Gen.24.15), [24](/gen#Gen.24.24), [47](/gen#Gen.24.47)). He appears in person only once (24:50).

bezaleel_490.name: Bezaleel (son of Uri)
bezaleel_490.bio: In the shadow of God; i.e., “under his protection”, the artificer who executed the work of art in connection with the tabernacle in the wilderness ([Ex. 31:2](/exod#Exod.31.2); [35:30](/exod#Exod.35.30)). He was engaged principally in works of metal, wood, and stone; while Aholiab, who was associated with him and subordinate to him, had the charge of the textile fabrics (36:1, 2; 38:22).

bigtha_494.name: Bigtha
bigtha_494.bio: Garden, or gift of fortune, one of the seven eunuchs or chamberlains who had charge of the harem of Ahasuerus ([Esther 1:10](/esth#Esth.1.10)).

bigthana_495.name: Bigthana
bigthana_495.bio: One of the eunuchs who “kept the door” in the court of Ahasuerus. With Teresh he conspired against the king’s life. Mordecai detected the conspiracy, and the culprits were hanged ([Esther 2:21-23](/esth#Esth.2.21); [6:1-3](/esth#Esth.6.1)).

bigvai_498.name: Bigvai (Name means 'in my body'. Apparently one)

bildad_499.name: Bildad
bildad_499.bio: Son of contention, one of Job’s friends. He is called “the Shuhite,” probably as belonging to Shuah, a district in Arabia, in which Shuah, the sixth son of Abraham by Keturah, settled ([Gen. 25:2](/gen#Gen.25.2)).

bilgah_500.name: Bilgah (the sixteenth to Immer)
bilgah_500.bio: The head of the fifteenth sacerdotal course for the temple service ([1 Chr. 24:14](/1chr#1Chr.24.14)).

bilgah_501.name: Bilgah (son of Shammua)
bilgah_501.bio: A priest who returned from Babylon with Zerubbabel ([Neh. 12:5](/neh#Neh.12.5), [18](/neh#Neh.12.18)).

bilhah_502.name: Bilhah
bilhah_502.bio: Faltering; bashful, Rachel’s handmaid, whom she gave to Jacob ([Gen. 29:29](/gen#Gen.29.29)). She was the mother of Dan and Naphtali ([Gen.

bilshan_505.name: Bilshan
bilshan_505.bio: Son of the tongue; i.e., “eloquent”, a man of some note who returned from the Captivity with Zerubbabel ([Ezra 2:2](/ezra#Ezra.2.2); [Neh. 7:7](/neh#Neh.7.7)).

birsha_513.name: Birsha
birsha_513.bio: Son of wickedness, a king of Gomorrah whom Abraham succoured in the invasion of Chedorlaomer ([Gen. 14:2](/gen#Gen.14.2)).

blastus_518.name: Blastus
blastus_518.bio: chamberlain to king Herod Agrippa I. ( Acts 12:20 ). Such persons generally had great influence with their masters.

boaz_519.name: Boaz
boaz_519.bio: The husband of Ruth, a wealthy Bethlehemite. By the “levirate law” the duty devolved on him of marrying Ruth the Moabitess ([Ruth 4:1-13](/ruth#Ruth.4.1)). He was a kinsman of Mahlon, her first husband.

bukki_522.name: Bukki (referred to in  1 Chronicles and Ezra as)

buz_529.name: Buz (son of Nahor)
buz_529.bio: The second son of Nahor and Milcah, and brother of Huz ([Gen. 22:21](/gen#Gen.22.21)). Elihu was one of his descendants ([Job 32:2](/job#Job.32.2)).

buz_530.name: Buz (son of Nahor)
buz_530.bio: One of the chiefs of the tribe of Gad ([1 Chr. 5:14](/1chr#1Chr.5.14)).
